result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Linda Drygalski Parrish was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda Drygalski Parrish

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:48 pm 
INCLUDES 20CM761, 20CM762, 21CM1147, 22CM477, 20TR1375, & 20TR1389. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Adam Nero. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
In 20CM762: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>AMEND to OWI 4th pursuant to 346.63(1)(a)(4). 
                    : Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
In 21CM1147: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>AMEND to OWI 5th pursuant to 346.63(1)(a)(5). 
                     : Cts. 2 & 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CM477: Cts. 1 - 3>>D&RI. 
In 20TR1375: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 20TR1375: Ct. 1>>DEEM REFUSAL LAWFUL.  
COURT grants above. 
State to efile amended complaints/informations. 

PLEA: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>GUILTY. 
In 20CM762: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>GUILTY. 
In 21CM1147: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Argument: Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 1>>45 days MCJ; $600 plus costs; DNA sample/surcharge; 30 months dl revocation with admin credit; 30 months IID; alcohol assessment; 6 pts against dl. 

In 20CM762: Amended Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ; $600 plus costs; DNA sample/surcharge; 36 months dl revocation with admin credit; 36 month IID; alcohol assessment; 6 pts against dl. 

In 21CM1147: Amended Ct. 1>>6 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 4 yrs ES - CONDITIONS OF ES>>Alcohol assessment (unless already done); mental health evaluation (unless already done); assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; $600 plus costs; 36 months dl revocation with admin credit; 36 months IID; 6 pts against dl. Def is eligible for SAP. Def is NOT eligible for CIP. 
 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit at this time - attys to submit stipulation re: jail credit. 
Adj: 3:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Calendar call on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Includes 21CM477, 21CM1147, 20CM761 and 20CM762. No driving without a valid driver's license.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 5 business days. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Prints and photograph. Shall not consume alcohol.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 24 hours of release.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:02 pm

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Wallace in person and with Atty Adam Nero by Zoom Video.

Atty Nero notes parties have an agreement and advises matter is set for plea/sentencing. 
Atty Nero notes he will be appearing pro bono in 22CM477. 
Atty Nero requests to be substituted as counsel in 21CM1147 for Atty Wallace - he will also appear pro bono in that file. 
Atty Wallace moves to withdraw in 21CM1147 and will submit order. 
COURT allows Atty Wallace to withdraw. 
State notes time limit issue in 22CM477 due to cash bond. 
COURT questions Atty Nero re: waiving time limits for trial. 
Atty Nero requests time to discuss time limits with his client. 
Atty Nero requests cash bond apply on all files. 
COURT ORDERS cash bond in 22CM477 apply on all files. 
CC set for 6/29/2022 at 1:00 pm to review status of time limits.
